title: Develop a basic iOS Profile or APP for VPN (No APP store, 1 page page)
desc: Key Details of the project:Main Project details:1) This is a 1 screen APP basic APP.2) The iOS Profile and/or APP will not be in the APP store. It will be downloaded by clients from a link and installed.3)  It will have a screen to select a server and a power button.4) We will need to chage the Username/Password or Certificate for every client we provide the Profile and/or APP to.5) The Profile and/or APP will use L2TP or OpenVPN.6) The Profile and/or APP will perform a basic function of connectivity (see below) that is currently unavailable in the apple configurator profile creator.Profile Always connected VPN. If disconnected. reconnect infinitely. (connect on demand feature?) If not connected when trying to connect retry until connected. Every user will have a different username and password, so we will need to edit the code for each user we provide the file to.Essentially that is all.Try this GitHub source code to see it it works without OpenVPN Connect app,[url removed, login to view][url removed, login to view]If it works we can just use that config profile.  You can see how the OpenVPN Connect app works in regards to reconnect, stay connect and retrying. The Profile and/or APP will need to work soomthly as that one runs (without connection disruptions)

title: 5 improvement tasks in an existing iPhone App
desc: Dear all, i need to get 5 tasks done in my iPhone app:1) A list is being displayed, sorted by a date in an sqlite database. For some reason the sorting does not work any more properly. It has worked before fine for a long time. So maybe new standards in operating system make the bug? (it is last updates list)2) I have a button which returns the German federal state you are currently staying in via GPS signal. This also has worked for a long time but is not working any more. If I hit the button, nothing happens! Also here it is possible that new functions in iOS make it fail. The app has been updated last time over 1 year ago.3) In the quiz part of the app, I developed a date dropdown menu where you can select month and day. For the month October and August you can only select 30 days although these months have 31 days. For March it shall be only 30 days, not 31. Same for September and November.4) add a piece of text: when hitting the “report error” button in the app, please include in the email the following sentence below the state/animal: “Bitte geben Sie die richtige Jagdzeit hier an, falls bekannt, idealerweise mit einer Quelle belegt, vielen Dank!” Can you also include the ios and app version below automatically?5) The app was last updated in July 2015 and needs to be brought up to iOS11 level. It shall be working in app store.Please include in your bid also proper documentation in the source code and your upload to the app store as I do not have a MAC.Looking forward to your bids, thank you and best regards!

title: IBEACON WEBVIEW APP
desc: Proximity iBeacon WebView AppThis is a simple Webview app where businesses can easily customize app with their logo and color theme. Upload beacons and create notification messages in just a few clicks with  No coding skills required.  The app needs to work with my beacons from Minew.App Features•	WebView•       Splash Screen•	Beacon Scanning•	Eddystone Nearby Notifications•	Integrated Beacon Gateway•      Easily upload pre-configured beacons.How it Works•	Splash Screen visible until website is loaded.  There is no lagging and blinking visible.•	Beacon Scanning –when app is launched it will automatically start scanning for your beacons.  If nearby beacon is found it will trigger the app to open the destination URL linked to that beacon wrapped inside app.•	Nearby Notifications – When your app is in the background on a user’s device and the user is in the vicinity of your beacon (within 100 meters) a notification is triggered and delivered to user’s device. t When a user taps on the notification, the app launcher opens your app and forwards user to the content linked to that beacon.•	Easy to use – Our iBeacon WebView app is super simple and easy to customize, you just need to upload your logo, change your theme color, register your preconfigured beacons, create your notification message, set your destination URL and you’re ready to go.NOTE;  THIS IS BASIC VERSION - PURCHASER CAN MANAGE ONE BEACON.  IF WORKER DOES GOOD JOB I WILL HAVE WORKER CREATE PREMIUM VERSION WHICH ALLOWS PURCHASER TO UPGRADE TO SUBSCRIPTION WITH PREMIUM FEATURES WHICH INCLUDES BEING ABLE TO MANAGE MULTIPLE BEACONS/CAMPAIGNS ETC.

title: Streaming Video app for Android
desc: Project overview:Build a streaming video app for Android phones. The app should have ability to connect to external camera over Bluetooth and WIFI.  Two types of cameras will be used in this design.  (go pro session camera and a IP camera).  The two video streams should be resizable on the interface app in which can be minimized as well.   Also looking to have a GPS map overlay on top of the two streams that are also resizable and can be minimized.  The streamed video output will be sent to the desired streaming server.  The output streams should include normal options for streaming servers, this test case will utilize Wowza streaming servers [url removed, login to view]  An option to utilize a dns name and ip address is required.  Options to stream to you tube, periscope and ustream are optional if they can be implemented.Project requirements1.	 Be able to capture streaming video from up to 2 external cameras and also phone camera.2.	Camera technologies,•	Go Pro line of cameras (similar to the go pro app capture),  Video Capture rate optionsH.264 - 1920 x 1440H.264 - 1920 x 1080H.264 - 1280 x 720H.264 - 1280 x 960H.264 - 848 x 480•	IP spy camera ( app settings similar to iminicam app)o	Video resolution 1080/720/640/480 optiono	15Fps to 30fps3.	GPS map overlay on top of video with gps coordinates from the cell phone for tracking.  (2 view options that can be resized to 1/8 , ¼ and ½ of screen.a. title: iPad App Code Review
desc: We are currently looking for an experienced Swift developer to review our existing application and provide insight into what it would take to fix some issues.Our application allows for creating simple drawings using lines, rectangles, and some predefined icons.  Every drawing is synced with our web application via an API to be distributed to other devices.  It is built with SpriteKit, Fabric, Crashlytics, SQLite, and Alamofire.This job will require a signed non-disclosure agreement and the ability to work with our development team.  Once the scope of work has been defined based on the outcome of the review, we would like to continue to work with the app developer to implement the fixes.

title: Android - Job Estimating Software, Including Scheduling and Invoicing and Payments
desc: I have a project that is partially completed.  I would like to continue with another developer.  I would like my software to take measurements and information about products and costs, and create a pdf estimate that I can email to clients.  This part is 99% complete.  However, I want companies to log in and create users, and cloud sync.  I need to be able to later convert estimates into invoices, and integrate with square to collect payments.  I would also like to have the ability to be schedule jobs with my google calendar, and have the software remind me of important tasks, like billing customers, and ordering materials for the job.  Framework is mostly complete, but may need to be modified in order to accommodate new vision.  This part of the project will require excellent English speaking skills.

title: Android/iOS app + API (partial offers possible)
desc: I am looking for someone that will create the MVP of an application. This includes either iOS or Android application and an API (preferably Java, PHP is not an option) to serve it. You can provide your quote for both app and API or just one of the parts. In the pricing I am expecting documentation, automatic tests and packaging (bonus points for docker/kuberbetes knowledge for API part). If you are interested please answer those questions:- Do you charge hourly or per feature/project?- What is your rate (including all possible fees)?- How much time can you commit to the project?- When can you start the work?Please also provide a link to portfolio, preferably including code samples.
